title: Phone During Dinner
situation: Your partner often scrolls their phone during dinner. You feel ignored but haven’t said anything clearly.
question: How do you bring it up?

choices.label: Make sarcastic comments about their phone every time they pick it up.
choices.outcome: The conversation becomes about your sarcasm instead of your need for connection.
choices.insight: Sarcasm hides the vulnerable part of the message, which is usually the part that actually needs to be heard.

choices.label: Say, “I miss you when we’re both on our phones at dinner. Could we try a no-phone rule for this one meal?”
choices.outcome: You name your experience and propose a specific experiment instead of a vague complaint.
choices.insight: Framing a change as a shared experiment feels lighter and more collaborative.

choices.label: Say nothing but secretly decide this means they don’t care about you like they used to.
choices.outcome: Your story about their behavior grows, but they don’t know anything is wrong.
choices.insight: Mind-reading is tempting, but it usually builds distance on top of misunderstandings.
